posts.name: Elaine
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.53 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • Now you can zoom in on a view-once image or video. What once was a bug has been fixed once and for all.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.52 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.53.0.695-beta

49 new commits since 7.52.0.686-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.53 [1]

  • Remove impossible-to-throw error [2]

  • Truncate too-long group names, instead of showing incorrect error [3]

  • Clean up AvatarHistoryManager [4]

  • Sync "default avatar colors" across devices [5]

  • Migrate all storage service records that will contain an avatar color [6]

  • Clean up MessageBackup+Shims [7]

  • Update to libsignal v0.67.6 [8]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.50.3 [9]

  • Update Backup.proto with latest contents [10]

  • Add one retry when fetching messages in the NSE [11]

  • Update call link colors to match spec [12]

  • Handle 422s instead of 403s when rotating pre keys [13]

  • Convert OWSHttpHeaders to a struct [14]

  • Rename OWSHttpHeaders → HttpHeaders [15]

  • Use HttpHeaders in more places [16]

  • Partially revert "Don't block prekey operations If message processing is idle." […] [17]

  • Migrate OWSRecipientIdentity to SDSCodableModel [18]

  • Add DeviceId type [19]

  • Validate DeviceIds using same criteria as server [20]

  • Remove AuthedDevice.DeviceId enum [21]

  • Remove some waitForProcessing code [22]

  • Make DBWriteTransaction only take sync completions [23]

  • Rename postNotificationNameAsync to postOnMainThread [24]

  • Put DeviceId uint32Value into request parameters, not the Swift type [25]

  • Upgrade info to warning for self-sent messages [26]

  • Fix race condition with “empty queue” notification [27]

  • Don’t use DeviceId in CallManager delegate [28]

  • Fix 20% chance of flakiness in unit tests [29]

  • Increase chance of primary/linked test failures [30]

  • Make a few MessageSender things private [31]

  • Add tag & feature flag support files for CI [32]

  • Conform LocalDeviceId to CustomStringConvertible [33]

  • Use a single timestamp through Backup import/export [34]

  • Use correct smart-quotes [35]

  • Exclude messages with <24h timers from Backup exports [36]

  • Remove references to KBS/SVR1 URLs in Info.plist [37]

  • Re-add test of RecipientMerger notifications [38]

  • Disallow editing of voice messages [39]

  • Simplify and rename updateConversionRates [40]

  • Clean up a few things with attachment errors [41]

  • Asyncify DonationSubscriptionManager (part 2) [42]

  • Add "no backup key" sheet [43]

  • Show spam reporting UI even if missing info [44]

  • Listen for audiosession interruption when recording voice messages [45]

  • ' [46]

  • Don’t localize “Signal Version:” [47]

  • Update release notes [48]

  • Update translations [49]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-iOS 7.52.0.686-beta…7.53.0.695-beta

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
I believe I have narrowed down the conditions necessary to make Signal crash in the background. I’ve noticed that every single time I’ve used Siri to set a 5 minute timer at a specific time of day, every 2 days, Signal immediately crashes in the background afterwards.

If you’d like any additional information, please do let me know :)
I haven’t added a debug log because I recall it not showing up last time.

It’s not every time Siri gets triggered, but when it happens, Siri has been triggered.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
I believe size calculation for attachments might be borked in this iOS beta. I didn’t find any specific changes but I’ll report in case I missed anything.

Signal refused to send a 97MB audio recording while desktop had no issues doing this.

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.53.0/bcbd85a10a91531b78ce85010eec1b1121f2f936bd570d9b05fb8b9907b89501.zip

BUG:
In chat details the “All media” option appears only if there is at least one picture or video in that very chat.
If there are only documents or voice notes, then it is hidden.

New Version: 7.53.0.699-beta

2 new commits since 7.53.0.695-beta:

  • Allow clearing erroneous local "payment processing" donation state [1]

  • Ensure suspension happens before change number [2]

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Thanks for the details. We’re aware of a class of issue that can cause Signal to crash when backgrounded: specifically, if we’re backgrounded while we have a file lock on the database (e.g., because we were in the middle of writing to the database when we were backgrounded), and another process (such as the Share Extension or NSE) tries to access the locked database file in the meantime, iOS will terminate the backgrounded main-app process. Documentation of this can be found here, under the 0xdead10cc section.

This produces the TestFlight “Signal crashed in the background” dialog, but is a silent error in production. It’s something we want to improve over time, but while it’s annoying it’s not causing any additional damage.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Ah, nice to hear : )

I’ll keep a look out if the latest iOS stable improves this since I haven’t seen any crashes since 18.4

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.54 release.
